BREAST-COMPOSITION: predominantly fibroglandular breast parenchyma with areas of fat (ACR A)
FINDINGS: A benign-appearing mass is seen in the upper outer quadrant of the breast. The margins are well-defined and smooth, with no spicules or irregularities noted. No suspicious microcalcifications or other concerning features are observed. Skin, nipple, and pectoral muscle appear normal. Short-term follow-up recommended for stability.
